intro: Scyphostelma trianae, commonly known as the Trianas' ghost flower, is a rare and enigmatic plant belonging to the family Melanthiaceae. It is characterized by its unique, delicate inflorescence that resembles a ghostly cluster of white, star-shaped flowers. Native to the Andean region of South America, it thrives in cool, humid environments at high altitudes. The plant has small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, Scyphostelma trianae is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
